intro: Ecbolium longiflorum, commonly known as the long-flowered ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically blooms in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often arranged alternately along the stem. Ecbolium longiflorum is often found in woodland areas and moist soils, thriving in partial to full shade.
